block.p: A front-page article in the Long Island and Westchester sections today contrasts budget management in Nassau and Westchester Counties. It examines the practices and overspending that left Nassau in perilous economic straits and reduced its bond rating, and the policies that have kept Westchester's fiscal status robust.
The article mentions one possible response to Nassau's problems, a $100 million bailout under discussion by state officials in Albany.

A front-page article in the Long Island and Westchester sections today contrasts budget management in Nassau and Westchester Counties. It examines the practices and overspending that left Nassau in perilous economic straits and reduced its bond rating, and the policies that have kept Westchester's fiscal status robust.
The article mentions one possible response to Nassau's problems, a $100 million bailout under discussion by state officials in Albany.

On Thursday, after the article had gone to press, Gov. George E. Pataki and the Legislature agreed to spend $105 million to bail out Nassau County and impose state oversight of county spending. Nassau will have to agree to make deep budget cuts in return for the state aid.
